server-config.title: Couldn't load server config!
server-config.message: The server "%(nameOfServer)s" doesn't exist in the config file.

socket.1000: Normal closure, meaning that the purpose for which the connection was established has been fulfilled.
socket.1001: Server is going down or a browser having navigated away from a page.
socket.1002: An endpoint is terminating the connection due to a protocol error
socket.1003: Wrong data type received by the server
socket.1004: Reserved. The specific meaning might be defined in the future.
socket.1005: No status code was actually present.
socket.1006: The connection was closed abnormally, e.g., without sending or receiving a Close control frame.
socket.1007: Server has received data within a message that was not consistent with the type of the message.
socket.1008: Server has received a message that 'violates its policy'.
socket.1009: Server received a message that is too big for it to process.
socket.1010:
Client expected the server to negotiate one or more extension, but the server didn't return them in the response message of the WebSocket handshake.
 Specifically, the extensions that are needed are: %(reason)s
socket.1011: Server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.
socket.1015: The connection was closed due to a failure to perform a TLS handshake (e.g., the server certificate can't be verified).

available.title: Update available
available.message: An update is available (%(currentVersion)s -> %(remoteVersion)s). Please download it HERE.

latest.title: Up to date!
latest.message: Good news, you're using the latest version of the LiveMap interface. Please enjoy %(currentVersion)s!
